pullRequest.title: Disable Aggregation DataStore by default
pullRequest.bodyText:
Resolves #1389
Description
Keep Aggregation DataStore disabled by default.
Motivation and Context
Please refer #1389
How Has This Been Tested?
Unit tests have been included.
Existing Tests Pass
License
I confirm that this contribution is made under an Apache 2.0 license and that I have the authority necessary to make this contribution on behalf of its copyright owner.

commit.message: Elide Standalone: Disable Aggregation DataStore by default

afterCommit.message: Elide Standalone: Disable Aggregation DataStore by default

commit.message: Elide Springboot: Disable Aggregation DataStore by default
Elide Springboot: Integration Test for Disable Aggregation DataStore by default

nodes.bodyText: Instead of reusing ControllerProperties, we should create a new properties file.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -43,6 +43,11 @@
      */
     private DynamicConfigProperties dynamicConfig;
 
+    /**
+     * Settings for the Aggregation Store.
+     */
+    private ControllerProperties aggregationStore;

nodes.bodyText: Since this class is exact replica of ControllerTest with few minor differences. I suggest we have ControllerBaseTest class with all the common test cases and ControllerTest and DisableAggStoreControllerTest will both inherit this class and add any unique test cases. This would keep making updates to test cases easier.
Can this extend ElideStandaloneTest as is ? and just override init and swaggerDocumentTest cases?
What is the benefit of changing the bean argument from a QueryEngine to a function which returns a QueryEngine?
This method seems to have two mechanisms for optional bean arguments (required = false) and the ObjectProvider.  I think the former might be the "Spring way"
Was this intended to have tests?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,16 @@

+package example.tests;
+
+import org.springframework.test.context.ActiveProfiles;
+
+/**
+ * Executes Async tests with Aggregation Store disabled.
+ */
+@ActiveProfiles("disableAggStore")
+public class DisableAggStoreAsyncTest extends AsyncTest {
+

nodes.bodyText:
If the enableAggregationDataStore is enabled, but the aggregation store or metadata store is not provided, we need a good way to alert the user to their configuration error.
Instead of using so many optionals, I'm wondering if we should provide different getDataStore methods with different required parameters (that we use Precondition to check are non-null).  Elide can call the right one depending on what is enabled/disabled.

commit.message: Overload getDataStore method to avoid Optionals
